alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 11:31AM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Henderson. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM EST, Gauge reports rising water levels along Mud and Bat Fork Creeks. Flooding will expand throughout Jackson Park. Airport Road will flood along with Dana and Tracy Creek Roads. Watch for encroaching floodwaters near New Hope Road and in the Hendersonville Airport. Along Mud Creek, watch for flooding near East Caswell Street along with the other flood prone low lying areas in this part of Hendersonville. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana and Crab Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
